name: Tensing Pen Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel offers beautiful surroundings, the cliffs and the sea. But that's where the pretty stuff stops. The hotel has 3 large dogs which run around in the restaurant and beg for food at the table. I like dogs but not when I'm eating. A restaurant is no place for animals because they are big and quite intimidating. I asked the staff to keep them away and remove them from the area, they shooed them but they were a continued presence at my meals. My complaints of the dogs were seen by the owner, an English gentlemen who lives at the property but treats it like he's some lord of the manor and makes the setting quite uncomfortable. Your not staying in a hotel here your staying in some Toff's house with his dogs, it's most unpleasant. I asked for the service charge to be removed from my bill at the end of my stay because the service in the restaurant was awful. Nothing is served with a smile and everything you order service 10% is added. Paying $9 for 3 red stripes is taking the biscuit enough, seeing as they are brewed on the island and available for $1.25 across the road but to pay 10 % service to a guy that doesn't smile or say hello, no welcoming approach. It's embarrassing that you have to try and make the situation enjoyable. Quite often the waiters won't even tell the kitchen you have ordered food so you will wait a long time then when it gets to the point that you have to ask is your food coming your then told its being prepared at which point they will remember, tell the kitchen and your food will arrive in an additional 15 mins. This did not just happen to me but also two other guests in my 3 day stay. 45 mins for a salad and then no smile or apology for the delay when it is served. 10%, thank you very much. I like to tip extra when I deem I've had a nice time or looked after but this place is so poor at doing this I feel disgusted to pay the service charge, especially as I have worked over a decade in hospitality. The rooms are very adorable but the sheets have lots of stains and the dogs leave their mess on the grounds so you can be sitting in the morning enjoying the sunrise on your balcony with a rather nasty smell in the air which the gardener will have to locate and cover with dirt. The rooms have safes which is just as well because the locks on the front doors don an be easily picked with a fingernail and the maid will usually leave the door unlocked.
reviews.title: Bad service in a Toff's manor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a beautiful location but that's not something they created and this location can be found at neighbouring properties so I would suggest you check others out. Apart from when I was swimming in the sea or sunbathing on the cliffs I didn't enjoy this establishment at all.
reviews.title: PARADISE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this place was my true paradise. amazing views. amazing staff. i couldve stayed here forever. nothing like those 'commercial' hotels. intimate. beautiful... i really cant say enough or find the words for this place. its perfect. and we already are scheduled to go back next year. THATS HOW GREAT IT IS. ive never 'doubled' a vacation spot!!
reviews.title: Impressive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been hooked on the All Inclusives, been all over the island Superclubs, Riu, etc. Took a recommendation to come here. It was unbelievable. Our room had the most beautiful view I have ever seen, from the sunset, to the moon rise. Extremely comfortable room with the little touches that made me smile. We ate at the resort twice for dinner because their restauraant was so good, and reasonably priced. While our room did not have air conditioning, we were comfortable at night because of the fans they have strategically placed. I can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Practically perfect - would give it 4.5 if given the option.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had a marvelous time this past week! The highlights:
reviews.title: WOW, I have found paradise!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have been to Negril several times. We've always stayed on 7 Mile beach at the all inclusives, but wanted to try the cliffs and "get out more".
reviews.title: Tranquility at Tensing Pen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room was much more beautiful than the pictures - which is remarkable! We stayed in Rock Cottage 1 facing the ocean. We could lie in bed and watch/hear the waves. We were a bit concerned that the room would not have air conditioning, but the cottage was ventilated so well that we had a continuous ocean breeze. It was perfect.
reviews.title: THE BEST TRIP EVEEEEEER!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at Tensing Pen was fantastic. The morning crew greeted us daily as though we were family. Mikey made sure we had snorkel gear and new what was available - and he is ALWAYS smiling, a wonderful guy. Our housekeeper Ruth was delightful and kept our room clean and stocked. The owners were warm and friendly. The pups (Rhodesian Ridgebacks) kept us company and are loving and well behaved. Such a treat when you are away from home and your own four legged family.
reviews.title: Amazing~ miss it already

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was delicious (the lobster here was the best we had on the island), and the Chick Pea Roti is out of this world! Everything was fresh and delicious.
reviews.title: Fall 2012 Wedding + Honeymoon @ Tensing Pen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property has a generous amount of private areas to dive, sun bathe, and swim. And every day between 3:45 and 4:15, a school of dolphins swim by - don't miss the dolphins!
reviews.title: Breathtaking Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Highlights: this property is nestled into the cliffs very nicely, with so many little areas to explore. The pool and snorkeling are lovely, and the whole family loved the bridge (no handrails!). It's a fairly quiet hotel, so if you're looking to stay away from the crowds this is perfect for you. The resident rhodesian ridgebacks wandering around are a fun addition. It seems that almost everything on site is hand-made and/or unique. I thought the food was fantastic, and lunch was a good value. Gardeners, cleaning staff and life guard were super friendly.
reviews.title: Bee-youtiful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Drawbacks: The restaurant wait staff have a real attitude problem- they are very aloof, almost resentful, and lack genuine friendliness (although they aren't outwardly rude). Like, if you're paying $20 a plate for dinner maybe the waiter could at least look at you while taking your order? Bar drinks are pricey.
reviews.title: Every Time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If it wasn't for the wait staff, I'd be falling over myself gushing over this place.
reviews.title: Beautiful scenery but lack of comfort and service (in restaurant)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Spent a relaxing, sun soaked week at Tensing Pen with a buddy and five 22 year olds- the boys stayed in the Long House and we took Red Birch Cottage-both were extremely comfortable and spacious. Really liked that we could get coolers for our cottages and have them filled with ice, beer and water everyday-made life very simple.
reviews.title: Beautiful but Meh on service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Many thanks to Gail,Ruth and Webster for keeping everything clean and never flinching about our odd sleep schedules.
reviews.title: It's like a paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband and I stayed in Garden B for two weeks. The property is gorgeous, here are my thoughts:
reviews.title: Amazing property - not so great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Property
reviews.title: Get Away Completely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amazing! Cliffs overlooking the ocean in the most beautiful part of Jamaica that I saw. It's basically set up with little hut-rooms throughout a jungle. Everything feels very private. The property is extremely clean and little pockets of comfy lawn chairs are everywhere. There are also four hammocks (2 pairs of two) that were super comfy. The pool area is in a lovely location and while the pool had many rust stains (it should really be resurfaced) it was always clean and a fun spot to hang out in. Be prepared for crabs and little bugs and lizards everywhere. The three dogs on the property are super friendly and they made our stay so much more fun!
reviews.title: Absolutely amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Room
reviews.title: Fabulous place + good times with friends

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh man, were we glad we had AC! We're from Southern California and not used to humidity so this was a life saver. The AC always worked super well. Wifi was super-spotty and only ended up working on our laptop and iPad, never on the iphones because the signal was too weak. If you see a wifi name that you get signal for that doesn't look like it belongs to Tensing Pen - ask the front office for the password. They have it and that's what we used the whole time ;) The bathroom's door was only wooden slats so you could hear absolutely everything going on in there. I hope you know your travel partner well and feel comfortable with that, lol. The room was small but fine. Bed was relatively hard and 3/4 pillows were lumpy. No soft bedding, just a sheet and stiff, thin, blanket. We would have loved it if the housekeepers had kept the front doors closed while they cleaned because they let in a lot of mosquitos and flies that way and we had to go on a killing spree each night before bed. There is no net over Garden B's bed. The bathroom windows don't have any glass, just screens so ants got in but nothing we couldn't handle. The bathroom had a little mold in the shower which I think they should work on as some people are very sensitive to that but I think that's just part of being by the ocean.
reviews.title: Zen at Tensing Pen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is poorly run, dogs in the hotel try to eat your breakfast, the dogs outside the hotel bark all night. Food is OK but limited choice. Not a sophisticated, particularly clean hotel and service is hit and miss.
reviews.title: Poor hotel, dogs bark all night, 2 star at best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tensing Pen is one of a kind. We truly had the time of our lives here! The resort is stunning. On arrival we were welcomed and we felt at home straight away. Everybody was so friendly and kind to us. We would always stop and talk to the staff, they were never once rude or seemed dis-interested. They always went out of there way to accomodate us 'EVERYTIIIIIIIME' The bar staff are hilarious! You can always hear them laughing along with guests, they're great!
reviews.title: Stunning views - Had the time of our lives

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had my birthday there and my partner proposed, was truly magical. Terri-Ann and Camilla organised everything. They set up a table for just the two of us in a hut which sits out in the sea, they decorated the walk way up to it with candles and tea lights. It was a complete surprise for me and I was blown away. They organised it with such detail and perfection, they listened to everything my partner had asked for and it was breathtaking. I was literally reduced to tears. We had our meal in there and everything was perfect. Best night of my life.
reviews.title: one of a kind

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Garden Studio with the ocean view, its a beautiful room. It can get quite hot in there as they aren't designed to sustain air conditoning. However, the rooms are equipped with two huge ceiling fans along with a free standing one, so if you have it near the bed whilst your sleeping, its comfortable. We were never un-comfortable. The rooms are cleaned to a high standard too. The rooms also have a mini fridge which was really handy for keeping drinks cold!
reviews.title: A little piece of heaven on earth!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The most amazing attribute that it possesses is the stunning views. Situated on the cliffs we could watch the sunset every evening, its so picturesque. The grounds, pool and surrounding areas are immaculate too. We also reccomend having the couples swedish massage. It was great! We ate lunch and dinner a few times, the restaurant is clean and has great views of the sea.
reviews.title: Top Notch!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our third stay at Tensing. We had the Red Birch cottage this time around, and have already booked for next years holiday. The place is amazing enough that it will be the only place we stay for the foreseeable future. It's worth noting that this was my thirteenth time visiting the island.
reviews.title: Third time. There will be a fourth... And fifth...etc...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013
reviews.text: There is a review further down that disparaged the owner of the resort. I brought this up while staying at the hotel a couple of weeks ago to one of the owners who found it amusing, as neither she nor her husband were actually in residence that week. From the owners to the housekeeping staff, down to the resort dogs, this place makes you feel like you are in your own tailor made tropical home. Frankly, in the nearly 15 years the wife and I have been traveling, have we ever been so welcomed, or so we'll treated as we were here.
reviews.title: Relaxation and VIEW!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort has dogs. Three of them. Large Rhodesian ridge backs. They are part and parcel of the vacation, and folks who do not like dogs, or are inclined to complain about them are well suited to go elsewhere. If you like animals, these three are simply amazing. For whatever reason, they adopted us on our trip, and followed us around like... Well... Puppies. The fact that the resort has, and cares so well for animals on site is a major reason we come back.
reviews.title: Nothing but relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Accommodations in the resort have been good wherever we stayed. This last trip, having red birch cottage (designed for four people) made our trip absolutely amazing, but I have also stayed in garden B (called their most economical room) and both south house rooms, all of which were quite lovely in their own way. The resort has neither phones nor televisions, amply outlined for any traveller doing research prior to going, and the lack of these is not an issue. The place is beautiful in it's own right, and I caught myself just watching the waves crash on the rocks for hours on end.
reviews.title: Perfect family wedding destination

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff. Most of the same staff has been there each time we return, and many are characters. Without exception, they have all made us feel welcome, but I have a few that have gone the extra mile to make my trip that much better. Tracey in the front office is amazingly sweet and kind, acting quickly on any request we might have. Her counterpart, Terry Ann is just as accommodating. Owen who works in the lodge has an always happy attitude, and makes me smile the second I see him. Mike, who seems to wear many hats was great for conversation and is just one of the kindest people I met there. Niney is one of the main grounds keepers. Get him in a conversation... He has been there since the 1970's, and planted most of the plants found on site. Amazing fellow to talk with. Jennifer.... Ah, Jennifer. She is a cook in the lodge, and has my heart. They say the way to a mans heart is through his stomach, and Jennifer found her way there, took up residence, and is on my mind whenever I crave a Jamaican breakfast or one of her delightful dinners. Dinner was typically served by Volliver (spelling may be off). This guy is very hard working, has a great attitude, and always was able to tell us a story. Make sure to ask him what the soup is (I bet it will be a "nice" soup no matter what day of the week it is). Management... I am bad with these names, as I did not have a huge interaction with them. There is a couple (they may be married) who run the hotel in the absence of the owners, and they were flat out amazing to my wife and I. We had an offsite experience on our last trip which could have potentially ruined our vacation, but the actions and attitude of the management staff was so amazing (including the resort owner) that it only served to cement my desire to return again and again to Tensing Pen. Finally, housekeeping. Often these individuals are overlooked, or fade into the background at the hotel. We had the pleasure of meeting Gloria who took care of us much of the week. Not only did she do an amazing job on the room, but she was also an interesting lady.
reviews.title: 13 Year Anniversary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is my second trip to Tensing Pen. My wife found the place purely by accident last year, and we will most likely be long term returning guests.
reviews.title: Second time, exceeded first.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This vacation was shortly after hurricane sandy hit Jamaica, and while Negril was largely spared, some damage was taken from the storm surge along the coast. I have the impression however that the tensing staff worked 24/7 to repair any damage, as the grounds were immaculate.
reviews.title: TRANQUIL - REJUVENATING

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The staff for this resort plays a large part in our desire to return. Housekeeping, front office, grounds and bar area all have wonderful people. A particular favorite of mine is Owen, he has always been a fun conversationalist, and made our first trip a pleasure. Having him remember my name when I arrived this time around made me feel like they really care about the guests.
reviews.title: Don't go anywhere else!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Rooms for this hotel are are quite nice. There is really something for everyone and they all offer their own type of privacy. We stayed in south house this trip. The view from the building is quite honestly phenomenal. There is a completely unobstructed view of the ocean, both rooms have air conditioning, and you are at the end of the resort. All of the pro's for the room outweigh the minimal con's which are only noise. In the early evening/afternoon the road noise is pretty heavy, and the neighbor (a private residence, this is not under the control of the hotel) has four dogs. I am a dog lover, but there were a couple of times I went out and told those dogs to be quiet... And I was not directing nice relaxing jamaica thoughts at them....
reviews.title: Tensing Pen: a Jamaican Jem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012
reviews.text: Meals at the hotel are a mixed bag. It's good, just not terribly consistent, I've noted that on the occasions when the resort owner is present, breakfast start times are punctual for the most part. This trip, owners were present at the beginning, but by the end of the week, start times were slipping.. Coinciding with the owners departure at mid-week. Dinner was food for every meal. The portions are good sized, and the food was quite tasty in my thinking. I was especially fond of the jerk pork kabobs as an appetizer.
reviews.title: Not number fiveNumber one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me first say that if you are considering a destination wedding and/or vacation in Jamaica this place is absolutely a perfect choice! Tensing Pen is simply wonderful! It is a warm, intimate, refined rustic experience. The owners, the staff, the property, the food, the EVERYTHING is out of this world! We have stayed at 2 other places in Negril, one of the popular all-inclusives on the beach as well as another location on the cliffs and neither can even compare to the gem that is Tensing Pen! We were under one of those worst case scenario situations with having a wedding during extreme bad weather not only coming, while we were there but also trying to head home because the hurricane had made its way north and I am still in awe by the personal service, care and attention we received at TP. It was just a dream! Here is the story followed by a short review of specific categories.
reviews.title: The perfect storm didn't stop the perfect wedding. Tensing Pen is OUTSTANDING!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hurricane hit Jamaica on 10/24. That was the day we were supposed to arrive with our wedding to be on the 27th. 22 guests were to arrive on the 26th for a 3 night wedding weekend. Our flight was cancelled due to the hurricane. The remarkable staff including the extraordinary owners, the best wedding coordinator Shanique, and various staff members called numerous times the day before and day of the hurricane with words of encouragement and info. I was concerned about them, a hurricane was coming their way but they assured me they were ok and called happy to report the eye of the storm had passed and Negril was spared major damage. They arranged to have someone pick us up from airport the following day. I highly recommend using their drivers. When we arrived the water was choppy but nothing too alarming. The night was great, we had a warm welcome, had out 1st amazing dinner at the Lodge, and some drinks with the unforgettable bartender, Razor. As we headed back to our room the aftermath of the hurricane started to kick in bringing crazy wind and waves crashing up over the cliffs. This went on all night bringing water into our awesome Rock Cottage II. That following morning it continued to get worse and we had to move to another room. Getting even worse we were moved to a 3rd room. Our guests were to arrive that night and 1 by 1 their rooms were becoming unavailable. Evelyn, one of the incredible owners, met with us throughout the entire day to figure out the most accommodating and comfortable arrangements for our guests who were on their way. She is absolutely wonderful and worked with us to figure out the best situation for everyone. Our guests arrived to this unexpected situation and agreed to these new accommodations. Despite the situation and all the hard work they were doing around the entire property post hurricane and removal of furniture etc, the staff somehow managed to magically transform the lodge that night for our welcome dinner even adding a pretty fabric shield to block the wind. The staff is amazing! The wind and waves continued to crash the entire night and like a miracle the following morning, our wedding day, the sun was shining and it calmed down enough to have our wedding. It was magical and surpassed any expectation I had! The following morning we woke to find out that everyone’s flights home were cancelled and they were to be stranded in paradise for 2 extra nights. The staff was quick to find new accommodations for everyone and we made it a group honeymoon! We had a pregnant guest who needed to leave before the airports closed within just hours and TP was awesome with trying to assist to make this happen and she was able to get the last 2 seats on the last flight out! TP had a driver ready to get her to the airport. We spent the unexpected group honeymooning jumping off the bridge, eating amazing food, exploring the neighborhood, relaxing, loving life, spending quality time…not in any specific order.  It was surreal and just a dream! I was lucky enough to have Tensing, the very very lovable dog on premises be my angel the entire trip following me wherever I went. Love him!!! I simply can’t recommend Tensing Pen enough.
reviews.title: No problem mon'!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Staff: Without the staff TP would just be an incredibly beautiful place. They are a talented group with great personalities that really make this place shine. The owners are excellent. The wedding coordinator is superb! The front office is so pleasant and helpful. The groundskeepers are excellent. House keeping is great. The chefs, servers, and bartenders are awesome. Everyone is so down to earth and just a pleasure to meet.
reviews.title: Great vacation spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The property: Heaven on earth. It’s filled with lush vegetation and great little spots to just relax. Beautiful, private, simple, and clean. The location and layout of this property is perfect. We stayed at another place on the cliffs and it just didn’t have the same feeling.
reviews.title: Tensing Pen... Great Resort!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Lodge: The food is fresh and prepared just right. I highly recommend the red snapper, beef tenderloin, and the lobster! Breakfasts were great. All you need is some of that delicious bread and some jam and your good to go but don’t get me wrong the omelets were delicious and loved the breakfast smoothie. Breakfast, lunch, or dinner, the lodge never disappoints. The servers and chefs are fantastic! Just go early because don’t forget you are on island time.
reviews.title: Best of Jamaica

description: Located on the West End of Negril, Jamaica in its own private cove, Tensing Pen is the ultimate destination for the discerning traveler offering a unique collection of beautiful hand-carved wood, thatch and cut stone cottages of varying sizes for the ultimate secluded and relaxing vacation.
